name: Python
description: A high-level, versatile programming language known for its readability and extensive libraries for web development, data science, and automation.

milestones.text: Can write and run basic scripts, understand variables, loops, and functions.
Can build a simple web application with a framework like Flask, use libraries like Pandas for data manipulation, and write unit tests.
Can design and architect complex applications, optimize performance, and mentor junior developers on best practices.

name: JavaScript
description: A core technology of the web, enabling interactive web pages and client-side scripting for frontend development.

milestones.text: Can manipulate the DOM, handle events, and make basic API calls using Fetch.
Understands asynchronous programming (Promises, async/await) and can build interactive UIs without a framework.
Masters advanced concepts like closures, prototypes, and the event loop. Can optimize performance and build complex applications.

name: React
description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly for single-page applications, developed by Facebook.

milestones.text: Can create functional components, manage state with `useState`, and handle props.
Understands component lifecycle using `useEffect`, can manage global state with Context API, and use React Router for navigation.
Can build custom hooks, optimize application performance with memoization, and architect large-scale React applications.

name: AI/ML
description: The field of developing computer systems that can perform tasks that normally require human intelligence, such as learning from data, recognizing patterns, and making decisions.

milestones.text: Understands fundamental concepts like supervised vs. unsupervised learning and can train a basic model using a library like Scikit-learn.
Can implement and tune various algorithms (e.g., CNNs, RNNs), perform feature engineering, and evaluate model performance rigorously.
Can design novel architectures, deploy models to production at scale, and stay current with state-of-the-art research papers.

name: .NET
description: A free, open-source developer platform by Microsoft for building web, mobile, desktop, and IoT applications.

milestones.text: Can build a simple console application and understand the basics of the Common Language Runtime (CLR).
Can create a web API or MVC web application using ASP.NET Core and connect to a database.
Can architect and deploy scalable, cloud-native microservices on Azure and optimize application performance.

name: AJAX
description: Asynchronous JavaScript and XML is a technique for creating fast and dynamic web pages by updating parts of a page without requiring a full reload.

milestones.text: Can use the Fetch API to retrieve data from an API and display it on a page.
Understands how to handle various HTTP methods (POST, PUT, DELETE) and manage asynchronous request states.
Can implement complex UI patterns that rely on background data fetching and handle potential race conditions.

name: Analytical Thinking
description: The ability to tackle complex problems by evaluating information, breaking it down into component parts, and identifying cause-and-effect relationships.

milestones.text: Can identify the key components of a problem or situation.
Can gather and interpret relevant data to find patterns and draw initial conclusions.
Can synthesize information from multiple sources to formulate and test hypotheses and make well-reasoned recommendations.

name: API Development
description: The skill of designing, building, and maintaining Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) which allow different software applications to communicate with each other.

milestones.text: Understands what an API is and can consume a public API using tools like Postman or cURL.
Can design and build a basic RESTful API with standard CRUD operations, including proper status codes and error handling.
Can design secure, scalable, and well-documented APIs, implement versioning, and understand different architectures like GraphQL.

name: AutoCAD
description: A commercial computer-aided design (CAD) and drafting software application by Autodesk used in architecture, engineering, and construction.

milestones.text: Can create and modify basic 2D drawings, use layers, and add dimensions.
Can create complex 2D designs and basic 3D models, and use blocks and external references (Xrefs).
Can create detailed 3D models and renderings, and automate tasks using AutoLISP or scripts.

name: Adaptability
description: The ability to adjust one's actions, course, or approach to changing conditions, and to embrace new methods and technologies in the workplace.
careerPaths: All professional roles, especially in fast-paced industries like tech and startups.

milestones.text: Remains calm and positive when faced with unexpected changes to tasks.
Quickly learns and applies new processes or tools when required for a project.
Anticipates industry shifts and proactively develops new skills or strategies to meet future challenges.

name: Adobe XD
description: A vector-based user experience design tool for web and mobile apps. Note: Adobe has discontinued active development of XD.

milestones.text: Can create wireframes and basic screen layouts using artboards and design assets.
Can build interactive prototypes with links, component states, and simple animations.
Can create and manage a complete design system with reusable components and share specs with developers.

name: Agile Methodologies
description: An iterative approach to project management and software development that helps teams deliver value to their customers faster and with fewer headaches.

milestones.text: Understands the core values and principles of the Agile Manifesto and can participate in team ceremonies.
Can effectively contribute to an agile team, estimate work using story points, and provide constructive feedback in retrospectives.
Can lead an agile team, facilitate all ceremonies, remove impediments, and coach others on agile practices.

name: Data Structures & Algorithms
description: Fundamental concepts for organizing, processing, and storing data efficiently and designing procedures to solve computational problems.

milestones.text: Understands and can implement basic structures like arrays, stacks, and queues. Familiar with Big O notation.
Can implement complex structures like trees and graphs, and analyze time/space complexity of various algorithms.
Can apply advanced algorithms (e.g., dynamic programming, graph traversal) to solve complex, novel problems efficiently.

name: Android Development
description: The process of creating applications for devices running the Android operating system, primarily using Kotlin or Java and the Android SDK.

milestones.text: Can build a simple single-screen app with basic UI elements and handle user input.
Can build multi-screen apps using Activities/Fragments, handle networking with Retrofit, and persist data locally with Room.
Can architect complex apps using modern patterns (MVVM), implement dependency injection with Dagger/Hilt, and publish to the Play Store.

name: Angular
description: A TypeScript-based, open-source web application framework by Google for building scalable single-page applications.

milestones.text: Can create components, use data binding, handle routing, and build basic template-driven forms.
Understands dependency injection, services, and can manage asynchronous operations with RxJS.
Can manage complex application state with NgRx, create custom structural directives, and optimize for performance.

name: Microsoft Azure
description: A cloud computing service by Microsoft for building, testing, deploying, and managing applications and services through Microsoft-managed data centers.

milestones.text: Can describe core Azure services (Compute, Storage, Networking) and can provision a VM or a basic web app via the portal.
Can deploy applications using Azure DevOps pipelines and manage infrastructure as code (IaC) with ARM templates or Bicep.
Can design and implement secure, scalable, and resilient cloud-native architectures using a wide range of Azure services.

name: Bootstrap
description: A popular, free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development.

milestones.text: Can use the grid system to create responsive layouts and apply basic components like buttons and navbars.
Can customize Bootstrap with Sass variables and use its JavaScript components effectively.
Can build complex, custom themes and integrate Bootstrap deeply into a modern JavaScript framework build process.

name: Blockchain
description: A distributed, immutable ledger technology that allows for secure recording of transactions and tracking of assets across a network.

milestones.text: Understands the fundamental concepts of blocks, chains, hashing, and decentralization.
Can write and deploy a basic smart contract on a test network like Ethereum.
Can design and build decentralized applications (dApps), understand consensus algorithms, and address security vulnerabilities.

name: C
description: A general-purpose, procedural computer programming language supporting structured programming, lexical variable scope, and recursion, with a static type system.

milestones.text: Understands syntax, data types, control flow, functions, and arrays.
Can effectively use pointers, manage memory manually (malloc/free), and work with file I/O.
Can write low-level, high-performance code, understand compiler intricacies, and work on operating system or embedded device codebases.

assessments: Technical Interview on Pointers and Memory

name: C#
description: A modern, object-oriented, and type-safe programming language developed by Microsoft for building robust applications on the .NET platform.

milestones.text: Understands syntax, variables, control flow, and basic OOP principles like classes and objects.
Can build web applications using ASP.NET Core, work with LINQ for data queries, and use async/await.
Masters asynchronous programming, dependency injection, and can design and build large-scale, enterprise-level applications.

name: C++
description: A high-performance, general-purpose programming language that is an extension of the C language, with added support for object-oriented programming.

milestones.text: Understands C syntax plus OOP concepts like classes, inheritance, and polymorphism.
Proficiently uses the Standard Template Library (STL), templates, and manages memory with smart pointers.
Can write highly optimized code, understands modern C++ standards (C++11/14/17/20), and works with multithreading.

assessments: Coding Challenge (often with focus on performance)

name: Computer-Aided Design (CAD)
description: The use of computers to aid in the creation, modification, analysis, or optimization of a design, particularly for 2D and 3D modeling.

milestones.text: Can create basic 2D sketches and simple 3D extrusions in a CAD software.
Can create complex multi-part assemblies and generate detailed technical drawings for manufacturing.
Can perform simulations (e.g., stress analysis) and use advanced surfacing techniques.

name: CSS
description: Cascading Style Sheets is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language like HTML.

milestones.text: Can apply styles using selectors, and understands the box model, colors, and fonts.
Can create responsive layouts using Flexbox and Grid, and understands concepts like specificity and positioning.
Masters advanced layout techniques, animations, and can write maintainable CSS at scale using preprocessors or CSS-in-JS.

name: Cloud Computing
description: The on-demand availability of computer system resources, especially data storage and computing power, without direct active management by the user.

milestones.text: Understands the basic concepts of IaaS, PaaS, SaaS and can describe the core services of a major cloud provider.
Can deploy and manage a simple application on a cloud platform, including setting up basic networking and security.
Can design and implement complex, scalable, cost-effective, and fault-tolerant architectures on a cloud platform.

name: Teamwork & Collaboration
description: The ability to work cooperatively with others as part of a team to achieve a common goal, including communicating effectively and respecting diverse perspectives.

milestones.text: Actively participates in team discussions and reliably completes assigned tasks.
Proactively communicates status, offers help to teammates, and provides constructive feedback.
Can mediate conflicts, build consensus, and foster a positive and inclusive team environment.

name: Computer Vision
description: A field of artificial intelligence that trains computers to interpret and understand the visual world from digital images or videos.

milestones.text: Can perform basic image processing tasks like filtering, thresholding, and transformations using a library like OpenCV.
Can implement and train a convolutional neural network (CNN) for an image classification task.
Can design and implement complex systems for real-time object detection, segmentation, or facial recognition.

name: Content Creation
description: The process of generating topic ideas that appeal to a target audience, creating written or visual content around those ideas, and making that information accessible to the audience as a blog, video, infographic, or other format.

milestones.text: Can write a clear and concise blog post on a given topic.
Can create a content calendar and produce various content types (e.g., articles, social media posts, simple videos) optimized for a specific platform.
Can develop and execute a comprehensive content strategy that drives measurable business goals like lead generation or brand awareness.

name: Creativity
description: The ability to think about a task or a problem in a new or different way, or the ability to use the imagination to generate new ideas.

milestones.text: Can generate multiple ideas during a brainstorming session.
Can connect seemingly unrelated concepts to propose a novel solution to a problem.
Can consistently generate groundbreaking ideas that challenge the status quo and lead to innovation.

name: Critical Thinking
description: The objective analysis and evaluation of an issue in order to form a judgment.
careerPaths: All leadership, engineering, research, and strategic roles.

milestones.text: Can identify assumptions and question the validity of a statement or argument.
Can analyze an issue from multiple perspectives and evaluate the evidence for each.
Can synthesize complex information, identify subtle biases, and construct a well-reasoned, evidence-based argument.

name: Cybersecurity
description: The practice of protecting systems, networks, and programs from digital attacks, which are usually aimed at accessing, changing, or destroying sensitive information.

milestones.text: Understands fundamental security principles (CIA triad), common threats (malware, phishing), and basic network concepts.
Can use security tools to identify vulnerabilities, analyze logs, and respond to basic security incidents.
Can design and implement a comprehensive security architecture, conduct advanced penetration tests, and develop security policies.

name: Data Visualization
description: The graphical representation of information and data. By using visual elements like charts, graphs, and maps, data visualization tools provide an accessible way to see and understand trends, outliers, and patterns in data.

milestones.text: Can create basic charts (bar, line, pie) in Excel or a BI tool to represent data.
Can choose the appropriate chart type for a given dataset and create interactive dashboards to explore data.
Can design compelling and insightful data stories that effectively communicate complex findings to a non-technical audience.

name: Django
description: A high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design, following the model-template-views (MTV) architectural pattern.

milestones.text: Can set up a project, create an app, define models, and render data in a template.
Can build a full CRUD application with user authentication, forms, and a connected database.
Can build scalable REST APIs with Django REST Framework, implement caching, and deploy a production-ready application.

name: Data Analysis
description: The process of inspecting, cleansing, transforming, and modeling data with the goal of discovering useful information, informing conclusions, and supporting decision-making.

milestones.text: Can use Excel or Google Sheets to clean data, perform calculations, and create basic charts.
Can use SQL to query databases and Pandas in Python to perform complex data manipulation and aggregation.
Can apply statistical tests, build predictive models, and present findings in a clear and compelling way to stakeholders.

name: Data Science
description: An interdisciplinary field that uses scientific methods, processes, algorithms and systems to extract knowledge and insights from structured and unstructured data.

milestones.text: Can clean and analyze data with Pandas and build a basic predictive model with Scikit-learn.
Can perform feature engineering, select and tune appropriate models, and rigorously evaluate their performance.
Can define a business problem as a data science problem, manage the end-to-end modeling lifecycle, and deploy models to production.

name: Decision Making
description: The cognitive process of selecting a course of action from among several alternative scenarios.

milestones.text: Can make clear decisions for well-defined tasks with limited variables.
Can make decisions in ambiguous situations by gathering relevant data and weighing potential outcomes.
Can make high-stakes strategic decisions with incomplete information, taking responsibility for the outcomes and learning from them.

name: DevOps
description: A set of practices that combines software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops) to shorten the systems development life cycle and provide continuous delivery with high software quality.

milestones.text: Understands DevOps principles and can use Git for version control.
Can create a CI/CD pipeline to automatically build, test, and deploy an application.
Can design, build, and maintain a scalable, resilient, and secure infrastructure using IaC and container orchestration tools.

name: Digital Marketing
description: The component of marketing that uses the Internet and online based digital technologies such as desktop computers, mobile phones and other digital media and platforms to promote products and services.

milestones.text: Understands the different channels of digital marketing and can manage a business social media profile.
Can run a basic ad campaign on Google or Facebook and analyze its performance using analytics tools.
Can develop and execute an integrated digital marketing strategy across multiple channels to achieve specific business objectives.

name: Docker
description: A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers, which package up code and all its dependencies so the application runs quickly and reliably from one computing environment to another.

milestones.text: Can write a Dockerfile to containerize a simple application and run it locally.
Can manage multi-container applications using Docker Compose and understands networking and volumes.
Can optimize container images for size and security, and manage container orchestration in a production environment.

name: Express.js
description: A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications.

milestones.text: Can set up a server, define routes, and send basic JSON responses.
Can create a full REST API with middleware for authentication and error handling.
Can structure a large, maintainable application, integrate with databases, and implement advanced features like WebSockets.

name: Emotional Intelligence
description: The ability to understand, use, and manage your own emotions in positive ways to relieve stress, communicate effectively, empathize with others, overcome challenges, and defuse conflict.

milestones.text: Can recognize their own emotions and how they affect their thoughts and behavior.
Can understand the emotions and perspectives of others (empathy) and use this to communicate effectively.
Can manage relationships, inspire and influence others, and navigate complex social situations with composure.

name: Figma
description: A collaborative, web-based interface design tool used for creating user interfaces, prototypes, and design systems.

milestones.text: Can create and style basic frames and shapes, and create simple wireframes.
Can build high-fidelity, interactive prototypes and use auto layout and components effectively.
Can create and maintain a comprehensive design system with variants and shared libraries for a team.

name: FastAPI
description: A modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.7+ based on standard Python type hints.

milestones.text: Can create a basic API with path operations and handle request bodies.
Can use Pydantic for data validation, implement dependency injection, and connect to a database.
Can implement advanced authentication, handle asynchronous tasks, and structure a large, production-ready application.

name: Firebase
description: A platform developed by Google for creating mobile and web applications. It provides a suite of tools for building, improving, and growing your app.

milestones.text: Can set up a project and use Firebase Authentication for user login.
Can build a full-stack application using Firestore for a real-time database and Firebase Hosting for deployment.
Can write and deploy Cloud Functions to run backend code and design complex security rules for Firestore.

name: Flask
description: A lightweight WSGI web application framework in Python. It is designed to make getting started quick and easy, with the ability to scale up to complex applications.

milestones.text: Can set up a simple application with routes and render templates.
Can build a REST API, handle forms, and connect to a database using an ORM like SQLAlchemy.
Can structure a large application using Blueprints, implement user authentication, and deploy to production.

name: Git
description: A free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

milestones.text: Can initialize a repository, and use `add`, `commit`, `push`, and `pull` for basic workflows.
Understands branching and merging, can resolve merge conflicts, and can work collaboratively on a feature branch.
Can use advanced commands like `rebase`, `cherry-pick`, and `bisect`, and understands Git internals.

name: GitHub
description: A provider of Internet hosting for software development and version control using Git. It offers the distributed version control of Git plus access control, bug tracking, software feature requests, task management, continuous integration, and wikis for every project.

milestones.text: Can create repositories, push code, and create pull requests.
Can effectively review pull requests, manage issues, and set up a basic project board.
Can create and manage complex CI/CD workflows with GitHub Actions and administer organization-level settings.

name: Go
description: An open-source programming language developed by Google that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

milestones.text: Understands syntax, data types, control flow, and basic concepts like structs and slices.
Can build a concurrent web service using goroutines and channels.
Can design and build high-performance, distributed systems, and understands the Go runtime and memory model.

name: GitLab
description: A complete DevOps platform, delivered as a single application, that provides a Git-repository manager providing wiki, issue-tracking and CI/CD pipeline features.

milestones.text: Can manage code in repositories and use the issue tracker.
Can create and manage a CI/CD pipeline to build, test, and deploy an application.
Can administer a self-hosted GitLab instance and implement advanced DevOps practices like Auto DevOps.

name: Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
description: A suite of cloud computing services offered by Google that runs on the same infrastructure that Google uses internally for its end-user products.

milestones.text: Can describe core GCP services and can provision a Compute Engine instance or a Cloud Storage bucket.
Can deploy containerized applications to GKE or Cloud Run and manage IAM permissions.
Can design and implement complex, scalable data pipelines with BigQuery and Dataflow, and architect secure enterprise solutions.

name: GraphQL
description: An open-source data query and manipulation language for APIs, and a runtime for fulfilling those queries with your existing data.

milestones.text: Understands the difference between GraphQL and REST, and can write basic queries and mutations.
Can design a GraphQL schema and build a basic GraphQL server that connects to a data source.
Can implement advanced features like subscriptions, caching, and data loaders to build a high-performance GraphQL API.

name: HTML
description: HyperText Markup Language is the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.

milestones.text: Can structure a basic web page with headings, paragraphs, lists, links, and images.
Understands semantic HTML5 tags (e.g., `<article>`, `<nav>`) and can create complex forms.
Masters accessibility (WAI-ARIA) best practices and can write clean, semantic markup for complex web applications.

name: Internet of Things (IoT)
description: The network of physical objects—"things"—that are embedded with sensors, software, and other technologies for the purpose of connecting and exchanging data with other devices and systems over the Internet.

milestones.text: Can program a microcontroller (like Arduino) to read sensor data and control an actuator.
Can connect a device to the internet and send data to a cloud platform using a protocol like MQTT.
Can design and build an end-to-end IoT solution, including hardware, firmware, cloud backend, and data analytics.

name: Java
description: A high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

milestones.text: Understands syntax, data types, control flow, and basic OOP principles.
Can build a web application using a framework like Spring Boot and work with collections and generics.
Masters multithreading, understands JVM internals and performance tuning, and can design large-scale enterprise applications.

name: Jira
description: A proprietary issue tracking product developed by Atlassian that allows bug tracking and agile project management.

milestones.text: Can create, update, and transition issues through a workflow.
Can create and configure a project board (Scrum or Kanban) and generate basic reports.
Can administer Jira, create complex workflows with custom fields and automation rules, and use JQL for advanced searches.

name: jQuery
description: A fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library. It makes things like HTML document traversal and manipulation, event handling, and animation much simpler with an easy-to-use API that works across a multitude of browsers.

milestones.text: Can select and manipulate DOM elements, and handle basic events.
Can use jQuery for AJAX requests and create simple animations and effects.
Can write custom jQuery plugins and understand its internals for debugging legacy codebases.

name: Keras
description: An open-source software library that provides a Python interface for artificial neural networks. Keras acts as an interface for the TensorFlow library.

milestones.text: Can build and train a simple sequential model for classification or regression.
Can use the functional API to build more complex models (e.g., with multiple inputs/outputs) and implement callbacks.
Can create custom layers and loss functions, and use Keras Tuner for hyperparameter optimization.

name: Kotlin
description: A cross-platform, statically typed, general-purpose programming language with type inference. Kotlin is designed to interoperate fully with Java, and the JVM version of Kotlin's standard library depends on the Java Class Library.

milestones.text: Understands syntax, null safety, data classes, and basic functions.
Can build an Android app or a backend service using coroutines for asynchronous programming.
Masters advanced features like extension functions, DSLs, and can build multiplatform projects.

name: Kubernetes
description: An open-source container orchestration system for automating software deployment, scaling, and management.

milestones.text: Understands the core concepts (Pods, Deployments, Services) and can deploy a simple application using `kubectl`.
Can manage application configuration with ConfigMaps/Secrets, set up persistent storage, and understand networking.
Can design and manage a production-grade cluster, implement advanced scheduling, and use service meshes like Istio.

name: Laravel
description: A free, open-source PHP web framework, created by Taylor Otwell and intended for the development of web applications following the model-view-controller (MVC) architectural pattern.

milestones.text: Can set up a project, create routes, and pass data to Blade templates.
Can build a full CRUD application with Eloquent ORM, migrations, and user authentication.
Can build REST APIs, work with the service container, and manage queues for background jobs.

name: Leadership
description: The ability to guide, inspire, and influence a group of individuals towards achieving a common goal.

milestones.text: Can take ownership of a feature or small project and guide it to completion.
Can mentor junior team members, delegate tasks effectively, and provide constructive feedback.
Can set a clear vision for a team or department, align individual goals with organizational strategy, and inspire high performance.

name: Linux
description: A family of open-source Unix-like operating systems based on the Linux kernel. It is the leading operating system on servers and other big iron systems.

milestones.text: Can navigate the file system and use basic commands (`ls`, `cd`, `pwd`, `mkdir`).
Can manage files, permissions, and processes, and write simple shell scripts.
Can administer a Linux server, manage networking and services, and perform advanced troubleshooting.

name: macOS
description: A series of proprietary graphical operating systems developed and marketed by Apple Inc. since 2001. It is the primary operating system for Apple's Mac computers.

milestones.text: Can use the graphical interface for daily tasks and install applications.
Is comfortable using the command line (Terminal) for development tasks and managing packages with Homebrew.
Can write scripts to automate tasks and troubleshoot system-level issues.

name: Matplotlib
description: A comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations in Python.

milestones.text: Can create basic plots like line, bar, and scatter plots using the `pyplot` API.
Can customize plots with labels, titles, colors, and can create subplots for comparison.
Can use the object-oriented API to create complex, publication-quality figures and custom visualizations.

name: MATLAB
description: A proprietary multi-paradigm programming language and numeric computing environment developed by MathWorks.

milestones.text: Can perform basic matrix operations and write simple scripts to solve mathematical problems.
Can create complex visualizations, implement numerical algorithms, and use specialized toolboxes.
Can build complex simulations in Simulink and develop standalone applications with MATLAB App Designer.

name: Microsoft SQL Server
description: A relational database management system developed by Microsoft.

milestones.text: Can write basic SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE queries.
Can write complex queries with JOINs, subqueries, and can create stored procedures and triggers.
Can perform database administration tasks, optimize query performance, and design database schemas.

name: MongoDB
description: A source-available cross-platform document-oriented database program. Classified as a NoSQL database program, MongoDB uses JSON-like documents with optional schemas.

milestones.text: Understands document-based storage and can perform basic CRUD operations on a collection.
Can design schemas, use the aggregation framework to build complex queries, and set up indexes.
Can manage replica sets and sharded clusters for high availability and scalability, and optimize performance.

name: MySQL
description: An open-source relational database management system (RDBMS).

milestones.text: Can write basic SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE queries and design simple tables.
Can write complex queries with JOINs and subqueries, and understands indexing.
Can perform database administration, optimize query performance, and manage replication and backups.

name: Next.js
description: An open-source web development framework built on top of React.js, enabling features such as server-side rendering and generating static websites.

milestones.text: Can create a new project, build pages with file-based routing, and fetch data for a page.
Understands the difference between SSR, SSG, and CSR and can build a full-stack application with API routes.
Can optimize performance with advanced data fetching strategies, manage authentication, and deploy to a platform like Vercel.

name: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
description: A subfield of linguistics, computer science, and artificial intelligence concerned with the interactions between computers and human language.

milestones.text: Can perform basic text processing tasks like tokenization and stop-word removal, and can train a simple sentiment analysis model.
Understands and can implement classic NLP models (e.g., TF-IDF, Word2Vec) and can fine-tune a pre-trained transformer model.
Can design and build complex NLP systems (e.g., chatbots, summarization tools) and stay current with state-of-the-art models.

name: Nmap
description: A free and open-source network scanner created by Gordon Lyon. Nmap is used to discover hosts and services on a computer network by sending packets and analyzing the responses.

milestones.text: Can perform a basic port scan on a target IP address.
Can use various scan types (e.g., SYN, UDP) and perform service version detection and OS detection.
Can use the Nmap Scripting Engine (NSE) to automate complex scanning and vulnerability detection tasks.

name: Node.js
description: An open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

milestones.text: Understands the event loop and can write a simple script that reads a file or creates a basic HTTP server.
Can build a REST API using a framework like Express and manage packages with npm.
Masters asynchronous programming (async/await, streams), can work with child processes, and can build scalable, high-performance applications.

name: NumPy
description: A library for the Python programming language, adding support for large, multi-dimensional arrays and matrices, along with a large collection of high-level mathematical functions to operate on these arrays.

milestones.text: Can create NumPy arrays and perform basic element-wise mathematical operations.
Can use broadcasting, indexing, and slicing to efficiently manipulate arrays.
Can use NumPy for complex linear algebra operations and understands how to optimize code for performance.

name: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
description: A programming paradigm based on the concept of "objects", which can contain data and code: data in the form of fields (often known as attributes or properties), and code, in the form of procedures (often known as methods).

milestones.text: Understands the concept of classes and objects and can define a simple class with attributes and methods.
Can correctly apply the four main principles of OOP (Encapsulation, Inheritance, Polymorphism, Abstraction) in a project.
Can design complex, maintainable software systems using OOP principles and design patterns (e.g., Singleton, Factory).

name: Operating System Concepts
description: The fundamental principles of system software that manages computer hardware and software resources and provides common services for computer programs.

milestones.text: Understands the role of an OS and can describe concepts like processes and threads.
Can explain concepts like virtual memory, scheduling algorithms, and file systems.
Understands concurrency issues like deadlocks and race conditions and how to solve them.

name: Oracle Database
description: A multi-model database management system produced and marketed by Oracle Corporation.

milestones.text: Can write basic SQL queries to interact with the database.
Can write complex queries and stored procedures using PL/SQL.
Can perform advanced database administration, tuning, and manage enterprise-level features like RAC.

name: Pandas
description: A software library written for the Python programming language for data manipulation and analysis. In particular, it offers data structures and operations for manipulating numerical tables and time series.

milestones.text: Can read data into a DataFrame and perform basic selections and filtering.
Can perform complex data cleaning, transformation, and aggregation using `groupby` and can merge/join DataFrames.
Can work with multi-level indexing, time-series data, and optimize memory and performance for large datasets.

name: Penetration Testing
description: An authorized simulated cyberattack on a computer system, performed to evaluate the security of the system.

milestones.text: Understands the testing methodology and can use automated scanners to find basic vulnerabilities.
Can manually identify and exploit common vulnerabilities like SQL injection and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).
Can perform advanced attacks, pivot through a network, write custom exploits, and produce a professional report.

name: PHP
description: A popular general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited to web development.

milestones.text: Understands syntax, variables, and can write simple scripts to process form data.
Understands OOP in PHP and can build a simple MVC application from scratch or with a framework.
Can build complex applications with a modern framework like Laravel or Symfony, write secure code, and use modern language features.

name: Adobe Photoshop
description: A raster graphics editor developed and published by Adobe Inc. for Windows and macOS.

milestones.text: Can perform basic image retouching, cropping, and work with layers.
Can use masks, adjustment layers, and blending modes for complex photo manipulation and compositing.
Masters advanced techniques like pen tool, color grading, and can create professional-grade digital art or designs from scratch.

name: Postman
description: An API platform for building and using APIs. Postman simplifies each step of the API lifecycle and streamlines collaboration so you can create better APIs—faster.

milestones.text: Can send requests to an API, inspect responses, and save requests in a collection.
Can use environments and variables, and write basic test scripts to validate API responses.
Can build complex automated testing suites, use the command-line runner (Newman) for CI/CD integration, and create mock servers.

name: Microsoft Power BI
description: An interactive data visualization software product developed by Microsoft with a primary focus on business intelligence.

milestones.text: Can connect to data sources and create basic reports with standard visuals.
Can transform data in Power Query Editor and write basic DAX measures to create interactive dashboards.
Can write complex DAX calculations, implement row-level security, and optimize data models for performance.

name: Power Systems
description: A network of electrical components deployed to supply, transfer, and use electric power. An example of a power system is the electrical grid that provides power to homes and industry.

milestones.text: Understands basic concepts of three-phase circuits, transformers, and transmission lines.
Can perform power flow and fault analysis on a simple power system.
Can design and analyze complex power grids, including protection schemes and stability studies.

name: Presentation Skills
description: The set of abilities that enable an individual to interact with an audience, transmit messages with clarity, engage the audience, and interpret and understand the mindset of the listeners.
careerPaths: Anyone in a client-facing or leadership role.

milestones.text: Can deliver a prepared presentation to a small, familiar audience.
Can structure a compelling narrative, design clear slides, and confidently present to a larger audience, handling basic questions.
Can command a room, adapt the presentation in real-time based on audience feedback, and persuasively communicate complex ideas.

name: Problem-Solving
description: The process of finding solutions to difficult or complex issues.

milestones.text: Can follow a defined procedure to solve a known problem.
Can break down a complex problem into smaller, manageable parts and identify potential solutions.
Can solve novel and ambiguous problems by devising a systematic approach, testing hypotheses, and implementing the most effective solution.

name: Product Management
description: An organizational function that guides every step of a product's lifecycle — from development to positioning and pricing — by focusing on the product and its customers first and foremost.

milestones.text: Can write clear user stories and manage a product backlog.
Can conduct user research, analyze data, and create a product roadmap with prioritized features.
Can define a long-term product vision and strategy, manage stakeholder expectations, and lead a product to market success.

assessments: Case Study Interview ("Design a product for X")

name: Project Management
description: The application of processes, methods, skills, knowledge and experience to achieve specific project objectives according to the project acceptance criteria within agreed parameters.

milestones.text: Can track tasks, update project status, and organize meetings.
Can create a project plan with a timeline, budget, and resources, and can manage project risks.
Can manage large, complex projects with multiple stakeholders, navigate organizational politics, and consistently deliver projects on time and on budget.

name: PyTorch
description: An open source machine learning framework based on the Torch library, used for applications such as computer vision and natural language processing, primarily developed by Facebook's AI Research lab.

milestones.text: Understands tensors and can build and train a simple neural network using `nn.Module`.
Can build custom datasets and dataloaders, implement complex model architectures, and use TensorBoard for visualization.
Can write highly optimized code, implement novel research papers, and deploy models to production.

name: R
description: A programming language and free software environment for statistical computing and graphics supported by the R Core Team and the R Foundation for Statistical Computing.

milestones.text: Can perform basic data manipulation with vectors and data frames.
Can use the Tidyverse (dplyr, ggplot2) for advanced data manipulation and visualization.
Can build interactive web applications with Shiny and write custom packages.

name: REST
description: Representational State Transfer is a software architectural style that defines a set of constraints for creating Web services. Web services that conform to the REST architectural style, called RESTful Web services, provide interoperability between computer systems on the Internet.

milestones.text: Understands the basic principles of REST, including resources and HTTP verbs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE).
Can design and build a RESTful API that uses proper status codes and has a logical resource structure.
Understands advanced concepts like HATEOAS, content negotiation, and caching to design highly scalable and maintainable APIs.

name: Redis
description: An in-memory data structure store, used as a distributed, in-memory key–value database, cache and message broker, with optional durability.

milestones.text: Can use basic commands like SET, GET, and DELETE for caching.
Can use more advanced data structures like Hashes, Lists, and Sets, and configure basic persistence.
Can use Redis for more than caching (e.g., as a message broker with Pub/Sub) and manage a Redis cluster for high availability.

name: SAP
description: Enterprise resource planning software developed by the German company SAP SE. SAP ERP incorporates the key business functions of an organization.

milestones.text: Can navigate the SAP GUI and understand the basic business processes within a core module (e.g., FI, SD).
Can configure a module to meet business requirements or write basic programs in ABAP.
Can lead an implementation project, design complex solutions, and integrate SAP with other systems.

name: Spring Boot
description: An open source Java-based framework used to create a micro Service. It is developed by Pivotal Team and is used to build stand-alone and production-ready spring applications.

milestones.text: Can create a new project and build a simple REST controller.
Can build a full CRUD application with a database connection (Spring Data JPA) and implement security.
Can build resilient microservices using patterns like service discovery and circuit breakers, and understands Spring internals.

name: SQLite
description: A C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine. SQLite is the most used database engine in the world.

milestones.text: Can create a database and tables, and perform basic CRUD operations.
Can use SQLite in a mobile or desktop application for local data storage.
Understands performance considerations and when (and when not) to use SQLite in a larger system.

name: Salesforce
description: A customer relationship management (CRM) platform that gives all your departments — including marketing, sales, commerce, and service — a single, shared view of every customer.

milestones.text: Can navigate the platform, manage user data, and create basic reports and dashboards.
Can automate business processes using Process Builder and Flow, or write basic Apex triggers.
Can design and build complex custom applications on the platform using Apex and Lightning Web Components.

name: Scikit-learn
description: A free software machine learning library for the Python programming language. It features various classification, regression and clustering algorithms including support vector machines, random forests, gradient boosting, k-means and DBSCAN.

milestones.text: Can load data and train a basic classification or regression model.
Can build a full machine learning pipeline, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
Can use advanced features like custom transformers and hyperparameter tuning to optimize model performance.

name: Scrum
description: A framework within which people can address complex adaptive problems, while productively and creatively delivering products of the highest possible value.

milestones.text: Understands the roles (Scrum Master, Product Owner, Development Team), events, and artifacts of Scrum.
Can effectively participate in or facilitate Scrum events and contribute to a high-performing team.
Can coach an organization on Scrum adoption and handle complex challenges related to the framework.

name: Seaborn
description: A Python data visualization library based on matplotlib. It provides a high-level interface for drawing attractive and informative statistical graphics.

milestones.text: Can create common statistical plots like box plots, violin plots, and heatmaps with a single line of code.
Can customize the aesthetics of plots and use FacetGrid to create complex multi-plot figures.
Can combine Seaborn with Matplotlib to create highly customized and publication-quality visualizations.

name: Signals and Systems
description: An area of electrical engineering and applied mathematics that deals with the analysis of signals and the systems that process them.

milestones.text: Understands the classification of signals and systems (e.g., continuous vs. discrete, linear vs. non-linear).
Can perform convolution and apply Fourier and Laplace transforms to analyze signals and systems.
Can design and analyze digital and analog filters and apply concepts to real-world applications like communications or control.

name: Sketch
description: A vector graphics editor for macOS, developed by the Dutch company Sketch B.V. It is primarily used for user interface and user experience design of websites and mobile apps.

milestones.text: Can create wireframes and basic designs using artboards and symbols.
Can create responsive designs using smart layouts and build interactive prototypes.
Can create and manage a comprehensive design system with shared libraries for a team.

name: Social Media Marketing
description: The use of social media platforms and websites to promote a product or service.

milestones.text: Can manage and post content to a brand's social media profiles.
Can create a content calendar, run a paid ad campaign, and analyze key performance metrics.
Can develop and execute a comprehensive social media strategy that integrates with overall marketing goals and drives measurable ROI.

name: Solidity
description: An object-oriented programming language for writing smart contracts. It is used for implementing smart contracts on various blockchain platforms, most notably, Ethereum.

milestones.text: Understands syntax and can write a simple smart contract with variables and functions.
Can build a smart contract that implements a standard like ERC-20 and understands common security pitfalls.
Can design and write complex, gas-optimized, and secure smart contracts for decentralized applications.

name: Statistical Analysis
description: The science of collecting, exploring, and presenting large amounts of data to discover underlying patterns and trends.

milestones.text: Understands descriptive statistics (mean, median, standard deviation) and can interpret basic charts.
Can perform hypothesis testing (e.g., t-tests, chi-squared tests) and build simple regression models.
Can apply a wide range of statistical models and techniques to solve complex business or research problems.

name: Time Management
description: The process of planning and exercising conscious control of time spent on specific activities, especially to increase effectiveness, efficiency, and productivity.

milestones.text: Can use a to-do list to track tasks and meet deadlines for individual work.
Can effectively prioritize tasks based on urgency and importance, and can plan their work week in advance.
Can manage multiple projects simultaneously, delegate effectively, and protect their time to focus on high-impact activities.

name: Tableau
description: An interactive data visualization software focused on business intelligence.

milestones.text: Can connect to a data source and create basic charts and dashboards.
Can create calculated fields, use parameters, and build complex, interactive dashboards.
Can use advanced features like Level of Detail (LOD) expressions, connect to various data sources, and optimize dashboard performance.

name: Tailwind CSS
description: A utility-first CSS framework packed with classes like `flex`, `pt-4`, `text-center` and `rotate-90` that can be composed to build any design, directly in your markup.

milestones.text: Can use basic utility classes for styling text, colors, and spacing.
Can build complex and responsive layouts using flexbox and grid utilities.
Can customize the framework with a `tailwind.config.js` file and extract components using the `@apply` directive.

name: TensorFlow
description: A free and open-source software library for machine learning and artificial intelligence. It can be used across a range of tasks but has a particular focus on training and inference of deep neural networks.

milestones.text: Can build and train a simple model using the high-level Keras API.
Can use the lower-level TensorFlow API to build custom models and use `tf.data` for efficient data pipelines.
Can build production-ready ML pipelines, deploy models with TensorFlow Serving, and optimize for performance on different hardware.

name: Tinkercad
description: A free, easy-to-use app for 3D design, electronics, and coding. It's used by teachers, kids, hobbyists, and designers to imagine, design, and make anything!

milestones.text: Can combine basic shapes to create a simple 3D model.
Can create more complex models using grouping and hole features.
Can design models for 3D printing or use the Circuits feature to simulate simple electronics.

name: TypeScript
description: A free and open-source high-level programming language developed by Microsoft that adds static typing with optional type annotations to JavaScript.

milestones.text: Can use basic types (string, number, boolean) and create simple interfaces.
Understands and can use generics, enums, and more complex types to build type-safe applications.
Can use advanced features like conditional types, mapped types, and decorators to create highly reusable and type-safe libraries or applications.

name: UI/UX Design
description: A discipline focused on creating user-centered products. UX (User Experience) deals with the overall feel of the product, while UI (User Interface) deals with its look and layout.

milestones.text: Can create wireframes and understand basic design principles.
Can conduct user research, create user personas, and design high-fidelity, interactive prototypes.
Can lead the end-to-end design process for a product, create and maintain a design system, and make data-driven design decisions.

name: Unit Testing
description: A software testing method by which individual units of source code—sets of one or more computer program modules together with associated control data, usage procedures, and operating procedures—are tested to determine whether they are fit for use.

milestones.text: Can write a simple test for a pure function that checks for a correct return value.
Can test more complex functions, including those with side effects, by using mocks and stubs.
Can apply Test-Driven Development (TDD) and achieve high test coverage for a complex application.

assessments: Coding Challenge with a testing component

name: VHDL
description: A hardware description language used in electronic design automation to describe digital and mixed-signal systems such as field-programmable gate arrays and integrated circuits.

milestones.text: Can describe simple combinational and sequential logic circuits.
Can design and simulate a moderately complex digital system, such as a simple processor.
Can design and verify complex, high-speed digital systems and understands advanced synthesis and timing analysis concepts.

name: Video Editing
description: The manipulation and arrangement of video shots. Video editing is used to structure and present all video information, including films and television shows, video advertisements and video essays.

milestones.text: Can perform basic cuts, add transitions, and sync audio to video.
Can perform color correction, basic audio mixing, and add simple motion graphics.
Can perform advanced color grading, complex visual effects, and can edit a feature-length film or documentary.

name: Visual Studio Code
description: A free source-code editor made by Microsoft for Windows, Linux and macOS. Features include support for debugging, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, code refactoring, and embedded Git.

milestones.text: Can open a project, edit files, and use the integrated terminal.
Can use the debugger, manage extensions, and customize settings.
Can create custom tasks, debug complex applications, and use advanced features like remote development.

name: Version Control
description: The practice of tracking and managing changes to software code. Version control systems are software tools that help software teams manage changes to source code over time.
careerPaths: All roles involving code or collaborative document creation.

milestones.text: Understands the need for version control and can commit changes to a local repository.
Can use a distributed version control system like Git for branching, merging, and collaborating with a team.
Understands different branching strategies (e.g., GitFlow) and can resolve complex merge conflicts.

name: Visual Studio
description: An integrated development environment (IDE) from Microsoft. It is used to develop computer programs, as well as websites, web apps, web services and mobile apps.

milestones.text: Can create a new project, write code, and run it.
Can use the debugger effectively, manage NuGet packages, and use integrated tools like the Test Explorer.
Can use advanced debugging features, performance profilers, and customize the IDE for maximum productivity.

name: Windows
description: A group of several proprietary graphical operating system families, all of which are developed and marketed by Microsoft.

milestones.text: Can use the graphical interface for daily tasks and manage files and applications.
Is comfortable using administrative tools, the command prompt, and PowerShell for basic tasks.
Can administer a Windows Server environment, manage Group Policy, and use advanced tools like the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL).

name: Wireshark
description: A free and open-source packet analyzer. It is used for network troubleshooting, analysis, software and communications protocol development, and education.

milestones.text: Can capture network traffic and apply basic display filters.
Can analyze common protocols (HTTP, DNS, TCP) and follow a TCP stream to reconstruct a conversation.
Can use advanced filtering and statistical tools to troubleshoot complex network problems or identify malicious activity.

name: Physical Design (VLSI)
description: The process of transforming a circuit description into the physical layout of an integrated circuit. It involves steps like floorplanning, placement, routing, and timing closure.

milestones.text: Understands the overall physical design flow and the purpose of each stage.
Can run the tools to perform placement and routing on a small block.
Can take a design from netlist to GDSII, achieving timing, power, and area goals for a complex chip.

name: Research Skills
description: The ability to search for, find, collect, analyze, interpret and evaluate information that is relevant to a subject.

milestones.text: Can use a search engine effectively to find answers to specific questions.
Can identify credible sources, synthesize information from multiple sources, and write a summary of findings.
Can conduct a comprehensive literature review, design a research study, and produce original insights or knowledge.

name: Self-Motivation
description: The ability to drive oneself to take initiative and action to pursue goals and complete tasks.

milestones.text: Completes assigned tasks without constant supervision.
Takes initiative to identify problems and propose solutions without being asked.
Sets ambitious personal and professional goals and consistently works towards them, even in the face of setbacks.

name: Shell Programming
description: The practice of writing scripts for a command-line interpreter (shell), typically for automating tasks, managing files, or controlling system processes.

milestones.text: Can write a simple script with variables, loops, and conditional statements.
Can write robust scripts that handle arguments, process files, and use standard command-line tools.
Can write complex automation scripts, handle error checking and signals, and understands shell scripting best practices.

name: Synthesis (VLSI)
description: The process in electronic design automation of converting a high-level description of a circuit (in VHDL or Verilog) into an optimized gate-level netlist.

milestones.text: Understands the purpose of synthesis and can run a basic synthesis script.
Can write synthesis constraints (e.g., for timing) and analyze synthesis reports.
Can optimize RTL code for better synthesis results and troubleshoot complex timing and area issues.

name: Static Timing Analysis (STA)
description: A method of computing the expected timing of a digital circuit without requiring simulation. It is a critical part of designing and verifying modern digital integrated circuits.

milestones.text: Understands basic timing concepts like setup time, hold time, and clock skew.
Can run STA tools, interpret timing reports, and identify basic timing violations.
Can debug complex timing paths, understand advanced concepts like on-chip variation (OCV), and develop strategies to close timing.

name: User Empathy
description: The ability to understand and share the feelings, thoughts, and experiences of another person, specifically the end-user of a product.

milestones.text: Listens to user feedback without becoming defensive.
Can articulate user needs and pain points based on research and advocate for them in team discussions.
Deeply understands the user's context and motivations, and uses that understanding to drive product decisions that lead to delightful experiences.

name: User Research
description: The systematic study of target users and their requirements, to add realistic contexts and insights to design processes.

milestones.text: Can observe a usability test and take effective notes.
Can plan and conduct user interviews or usability tests and synthesize the findings into actionable insights.
Can design a comprehensive research strategy using a mix of qualitative and quantitative methods to answer complex business and design questions.

name: Verification (VLSI)
description: The process of confirming that a digital circuit design meets its specifications. It is a crucial and time-consuming part of the chip design cycle.

milestones.text: Understands the purpose of verification and can write simple testbenches.
Can build a constrained-random, coverage-driven verification environment using a methodology like UVM.
Can develop a comprehensive verification plan for a complex SoC and lead a team to achieve verification closure.

name: Virtualization
description: The act of creating a virtual version of something, including virtual computer hardware platforms, storage devices, and computer network resources.

milestones.text: Can create and run a virtual machine on their local computer using software like VirtualBox.
Understands different types of hypervisors and can manage VMs in a server environment like VMware vSphere.
Can design and manage a large-scale virtualized infrastructure for an enterprise, including networking and storage.

name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
description: A comprehensive and widely adopted cloud platform, offering over 200 fully featured services from data centers globally.

milestones.text: Understands core services (EC2, S3, IAM) and can launch a basic virtual server.
Can deploy a web application, configure a VPC, and manage database services like RDS.
Can design and implement highly available, scalable, and fault-tolerant systems using a wide range of AWS services.

assessments: AWS Certification (e.g., Cloud Practitioner, Solutions Architect)

name: Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
description: The practice of automating the build, test, and deployment phases of the software release process, enabling teams to deliver code changes more frequently and reliably.

milestones.text: Understands the concepts of CI and CD and can configure a simple pipeline from a template.
Can build a multi-stage pipeline that automatically builds, tests, and deploys an application to a staging environment.
Can design and manage complex, secure, and scalable CI/CD pipelines for microservices architectures, including canary deployments and rollbacks.

name: Ethers.js
description: A compact and complete JavaScript library for interacting with the Ethereum Blockchain and its ecosystem.

milestones.text: Can connect to the Ethereum network, query balances, and read data from smart contracts.
Can sign and send transactions to call state-changing functions on smart contracts.
Can build a complete decentralized application (dApp) frontend that interacts with multiple smart contracts.

name: Ethereum
description: A decentralized, open-source blockchain with smart contract functionality. Ether (ETH) is the native cryptocurrency of the platform.

milestones.text: Understands the concept of gas, transactions, and the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM).
Can deploy and interact with smart contracts on a testnet.
Understands complex topics like Layer 2 scaling solutions, MEV, and can design secure and efficient smart contract systems.

name: IPFS (InterPlanetary File System)
description: A peer-to-peer hypermedia protocol designed to make the web faster, safer, and more open by storing files in a distributed, content-addressed manner.

milestones.text: Understands content addressing (CIDs) and can add and retrieve files from the IPFS network using a public gateway.
Can run a local IPFS node and use the CLI or an SDK to interact with the network.
Can build applications that rely on IPFS for decentralized data storage and understand the intricacies of pinning services.

name: JSON Web Token (JWT)
description: An open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information between parties as a JSON object. This information can be verified and trusted because it is digitally signed.

milestones.text: Understands the structure of a JWT (Header, Payload, Signature) and its purpose in stateless authentication.
Can implement token-based authentication in a web application, including token generation, validation, and storage.
Understands the security implications of different signing algorithms (HS256 vs RS256) and knows how to handle token refresh and revocation.

name: Jupyter Notebook
description: An open-source web application that allows you to create and share documents that contain live code, equations, visualizations, and narrative text.

milestones.text: Can create a notebook, run code in cells, and use Markdown for text.
Can use magic commands and install packages within the notebook for efficient exploratory data analysis.
Can create interactive visualizations and use extensions to build complex, shareable reports and dashboards.

name: LangChain
description: A framework for developing applications powered by large language models (LLMs). It provides modular components and chains for building complex applications like chatbots and question-answering systems.

milestones.text: Can create a simple chain to pass a prompt to an LLM and get a response.
Can build a question-answering application over a set of documents using a RAG chain.
Can create custom chains and agents, and integrate multiple tools to build complex, autonomous systems.

name: LLM Fine-tuning
description: The process of taking a pre-trained Large Language Model (LLM) and further training it on a smaller, specific dataset to adapt it for a particular task or improve its performance in a specific domain.

milestones.text: Understands the concept of fine-tuning and can run a pre-written script to fine-tune a model on a new dataset.
Can prepare a custom dataset and fine-tune a model like GPT-2 or BERT for a specific task like text classification.
Can implement advanced fine-tuning techniques (e.g., LoRA, PEFT), evaluate the results rigorously, and manage the training process on cloud infrastructure.

name: LlamaIndex
description: A data framework for LLM applications that provides tools to ingest, structure, and access private or domain-specific data for use in applications like question-answering.

milestones.text: Can use LlamaIndex to load documents and build a basic index.
Can build a query engine over an index to perform question-answering on custom data.
Can create complex data pipelines with multiple indexes and query engines, and customize components for specific use cases.

name: PostgreSQL
description: A powerful, open-source object-relational database system with over 30 years of active development that has earned it a strong reputation for reliability, feature robustness, and performance.

milestones.text: Can write basic CRUD queries and understands primary data types.
Can write complex queries with JOINs, use transactions, and understands indexing strategies.
Can use advanced features like JSONB, write custom functions, and perform database administration and performance tuning.

name: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
description: An AI framework for improving the quality of LLM-generated responses by grounding the model on external sources of knowledge to supplement the LLM’s internal representation of information.

milestones.text: Understands the concept of retrieving documents to provide context to an LLM prompt.
Can build a basic RAG pipeline using a framework like LangChain to answer questions from a document set.
Can design and optimize complex RAG systems, including advanced retrieval strategies and document chunking, for production use.

name: Smart Contracts
description: Self-executing contracts with the terms of the agreement between buyer and seller being directly written into lines of code. The code and the agreements contained therein exist across a distributed, decentralized blockchain network.

milestones.text: Understands the concept of a smart contract and can read a simple one written in Solidity.
Can write, test, and deploy a basic smart contract (e.g., an ERC20 token) to a testnet.
Can design and implement complex, secure, and gas-efficient smart contract systems for production dApps.

name: Transformers (AI Model)
description: A deep learning model architecture that adopts the mechanism of self-attention, differentially weighting the significance of each part of the input data. It is the foundational architecture for most modern large language models (LLMs).

milestones.text: Understands the high-level concept of self-attention and how transformers differ from RNNs/LSTMs.
Can use a library like Hugging Face Transformers to fine-tune a pre-trained model (e.g., BERT) for a downstream task.
Can implement a transformer model from scratch and understands the mathematical details of the architecture.

name: Web3.js
description: A collection of libraries that allow you to interact with a local or remote Ethereum node using HTTP, IPC or WebSocket.

milestones.text: Can connect to an Ethereum node and retrieve basic blockchain data like the latest block number.
Can interact with smart contracts by calling read-only functions and sending transactions.
Can build a complete frontend for a decentralized application, handling events and managing user accounts.

name: 3D Printing
description: 3D printing is a manufacturing process that creates three-dimensional objects layer by layer from digital models, enabling rapid prototyping and custom production.

milestones.text: Successfully create and print a simple 3D object using a basic 3D printer.
Design and print a functional prototype using CAD software and advanced printing techniques.
Develop and optimize a complex 3D printing process for a specific application, including material selection and post-processing.

name: ABAP
description: ABAP is a high-level programming language created by SAP for developing applications on the SAP platform, enabling customization and enhancement of SAP software solutions.

milestones.text: Complete a basic ABAP programming course and write simple reports using ABAP.
Develop a functional module in ABAP and integrate it with an SAP application.
Design and implement a complex ABAP program that utilizes performance optimization techniques.

name: Abstraction
description: Abstraction is a fundamental concept in computer science that involves simplifying complex systems by hiding unnecessary details and exposing only the essential features.

milestones.text: Understand the basic principles of abstraction and identify examples in programming languages.
Implement abstraction in code using classes and interfaces in at least one programming language.
Design and architect a software system that effectively utilizes abstraction to manage complexity.

name: Academic Databases (JSTOR, PubMed)
description: Academic databases like JSTOR and PubMed provide access to scholarly articles, research papers, and academic resources essential for research and education across various disciplines.

milestones.text: Successfully navigate and perform basic searches in JSTOR and PubMed.
Compile a list of relevant articles from academic databases for a specific research topic.
Conduct a comprehensive literature review using multiple academic databases and synthesize findings.

name: Active Listening
description: Active listening is the practice of fully concentrating, understanding, responding, and remembering what is being said in a conversation, enhancing communication effectiveness.

milestones.text: Demonstrate the ability to summarize key points from a conversation accurately.
Engage in a conversation while asking clarifying questions to ensure understanding.
Facilitate a group discussion, ensuring all participants feel heard and valued.

name: Adobe Creative Cloud
description: Adobe Creative Cloud is a suite of applications for graphic design, video editing, web development, and photography, providing tools for creative professionals to produce high-quality content.

milestones.text: Complete a basic tutorial on Adobe Photoshop and create a simple graphic design project.
Design a multi-page brochure using Adobe InDesign, incorporating images and text layouts.
Produce a short promotional video using Adobe Premiere Pro, including advanced editing techniques and effects.

name: Adobe Creative Suite
description: Adobe Creative Suite is a collection of graphic design, video editing, and web development applications used by professionals to create and manage digital content.

milestones.text: Complete a basic project using Adobe Photoshop, such as creating a simple poster or social media graphic.
Design a multi-page brochure using Adobe InDesign, incorporating images and text effectively.
Produce a short promotional video using Adobe Premiere Pro, demonstrating advanced editing techniques and effects.

name: Adobe Premiere Pro
description: Adobe Premiere Pro is a professional video editing software used for creating and editing high-quality videos, films, and multimedia content across various platforms.

milestones.text: Complete a basic video editing project using Premiere Pro, including cutting clips and adding transitions.
Create a polished video with advanced editing techniques, including color correction and audio mixing.
Produce a professional-grade video project that incorporates motion graphics and complex effects.

assessments: Practical editing test using Premiere Pro

name: After Effects
description: Adobe After Effects is a powerful software used for creating motion graphics and visual effects in film, video, and web production, enhancing storytelling through animation.

milestones.text: Create a simple animated text project using basic keyframing techniques.
Produce a short video incorporating multiple layers, effects, and transitions.
